DOC.brief_title: The Effect Dexamethasone Duration Interscalene Nerve Blocks With Ropivacaine Bupivacaine
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize study four group patient undergo shoulder surgery use interscalene nerve block . The study investigate effect dexamethasone analgesic duration . Participants randomize one four group : - Ropivacaine : 30 ml 0.5 % ropivacaine plus 2 ml 0.9 % saline ( placebo ) interscalene block ; - Bupivacaine : 30 ml 0.5 % bupivacaine plus 2 ml 0.9 % saline ( placebo ) ; - Ropivacaine steroid : 30 ml 0.5 % ropivacaine plus dexamethasone 8 mg ( 2 ml ) mix local anesthetic ; - Bupivacaine steroid : 30 ml 0.5 % bupivacaine plus dexamethasone 8 mg ( 2 ml ) mix local anesthetic . The primary outcome duration interscalene nerve block time first administration pain medication block A blind observer interview patient morning three day postoperatively , either hospital telephone 14 day post operatively .
DOC.criteria: Age 18 75 year Patients undergo shoulder procedure rotator cuff repair capsular shift shoulder arthroplasty subacromial decompression Contraindications interscalene block ( Coagulopathy , infection needle insertion site , moderate severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , contralateral pneumothorax diaphragmatic paralysis ) Pregnancy Preexisting neuropathy involve surgical limb Systemic glucocorticoid treatment ( 2 week ) within six month surgery
